documentation/cloud-nodes.title: Cloud Nodes
documentation/cloud-nodes.description: This document provides an overview of the Cloud Nodes, their purpose, configuration options, and usage.

documentation/connection-nodes.title: Connection Nodes
documentation/connection-nodes.description: Connection Nodes are designed to integrate external data sources or destinations into the workflow. They handle communication protocols and ensure data flows smoothly between your workflow and external systems.

documentation/custom-nodes.title: Custom Nodes
documentation/custom-nodes.description: Custom nodes were designed to be easily written and greatly expandable. You

documentation/flow-control-nodes.title: Flow Control Nodes
documentation/flow-control-nodes.description: Define common variables accessible across all nodes in a flow.

documentation/io-nodes.title: IO Nodes
documentation/io-nodes.description: This document provides detailed information about the available I/O Nodes. Each node is described with its functionality, options, and exceptions.

documentation/manipulation-nodes.title: Manipulation Nodes
documentation/manipulation-nodes.description: Manipulation Node classes implement processing for JSON-like data. These nodes operate on JSON input streams, transforming, filtering, or aggregating data.

getting-started/congratulations.title: Congratulations!
getting-started/congratulations.description: You have just learned the basics of Matterflow and how to create automated data flows.

getting-started/create-a-custom-node.title: Create a Custom Node
getting-started/create-a-custom-node.description: One very powerful feature of Matterflow is its support for custom nodes. New data

getting-started/create-a-flow.title: Create a Flow
getting-started/create-a-flow.description: Learn how to create an automated workflow in Matterflow to gather, transform, and send data from Matter-enabled IoT devices to cloud or AI applications.

getting-started/create-a-model.title: Create a Model
getting-started/create-a-model.description: The Model editor tool is designed to help you create and manage models for data mapping from Matter enabled devices.

getting-started/export-import-flows.title: Export and Import Flows
getting-started/export-import-flows.description: Users can export and import matterflows as JSON files, facilitating backing up flows and sharing flows with other users.

getting-started/start-your-flow.title: Start your flow
getting-started/start-your-flow.description: Once you have created you flow to process data you will want to run your flow as a process. Matterflow uses Supervisord to manage processes in the background. Supervisord is responsible for starting flow processes, responding to start/stop commands from the user interface, restarting crashed or exited subprocesseses.

installation/installation.title: Installation Guide
installation/installation.description: Matterflow offers multiple installation options to fit your environment.

intro.title: Welcome to Matterflow
intro.description: Want to get data from Matter-Enabled IoT Devices?
